intro: Descurainia pinnata var. filipes, commonly known as slender leafed tansy, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its leaves are slender and linear, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its adaptability and ability to stabilize soil.
